description: NHL 25 opponent archetype map for Leafs-Dynasty-AI-v5. Each team is assigned a primary archetype that drives default gameplan behaviour, system choices, and mode selection (Neutral / Lockdown / Chase).

archetypes.label: Trap / Low-Event
archetypes.summary: Heavy defensive structure, neutral-zone trap, low-shot-volume games. Games tend to be 2–1, 3–2.

archetypes.label: Chaos Rush
archetypes.summary: Fast north–south, aggressive forecheck, lots of rush chances and broken plays.

archetypes.label: Slow Umbrella / Shooting PP
archetypes.summary: Slower 5v5 pace but dangerous from point shots and umbrella/OV-style power plays.

archetypes.label: Heavy Cycle
archetypes.summary: Boards, down-low pressure, net-front traffic and point shots. Try to grind you down.

archetypes.label: Pressure Forecheck
archetypes.summary: Relentless forecheck, pinching D, pressure-first identity at 5v5.

archetypes.label: Speed / Transition
archetypes.summary: Attack off the rush, quick ups, stretch plays, high-tempo entries.

archetypes.label: Elite Rush Offense
archetypes.summary: Top-end skill that lives off rush chances, east–west plays and one-timers.

archetypes.label: Balanced Superstar Core
archetypes.summary: High-end talent with a reasonably balanced structure at 5v5.

archetypes.label: Structured Skill
archetypes.summary: Solid system play with good skill; dangerous if you give them time and space.

archetypes.label: Rebuild / Loose Structure
archetypes.summary: Weaker structure, more mistakes, but still dangerous off broken plays and momentum swings.

archetypes.label: Mid-Pressure Forecheck
archetypes.summary: Middle of the pack: some pressure, some trap, not extreme in either direction.

archetypes.label: Balanced Depth Team
archetypes.summary: Four-line depth, not overly star-dependent; pressure through depth and structure.

archetypes.label: Counterpunch Trap
archetypes.summary: Defend first, then counterattack off turnovers and mistakes.

archetypes.label: Rush / Cycle Hybrid
archetypes.summary: Comfortable attacking off the rush or with sustained cycle time.

archetypes.label: Veteran Skill + Cycle
archetypes.summary: Older core, relies on IQ, puck movement and cycle more than raw speed.

archetypes.label: Hybrid Skill Attack
archetypes.summary: High-end offensive talent with a mix of rush, cycle and set plays.

teams.notes: Treat as a looser-structure rebuild team: punish turnovers, but respect individual skill spikes.
Rebuild group with streaky offense; focus on structure and let their inconsistency beat them.
Heavy cycle, strong slot protection, good goaltending. Battle net-front and protect the middle.
Young, fast, dangerous off the rush. Prioritize neutral-zone control and gap management.
Middle-of-the-pack forecheck team; not extreme, but punishes sloppy exits and lazy backchecks.
Relentless forecheck, high shot volume, activate D; must have crisp breakouts and good support.
Rebuild team with some skilled pieces; play patient and let structure win.
Rebuild with a superstar focal point. Focus on shutting down the top line and living with the rest.
Superstar core with strong transition and cycle options. Need disciplined line matching and backcheck.
Heavy, structured team with scoring depth. Win inside the dots and manage rebounds carefully.
Chaos-driven rush team with dangerous curl shooters. Use trap slider rules and curl-shooter patch.
Elite rush and powerplay team. Prioritize neutral-zone schemes and deny middle on entries.
High-pressure forecheck with heavy cycle game. Quick breakouts and disciplined exits are mandatory.
Structured, possession team. Respect their system, attack when they change or mismanage pucks.
Heavy, grinding team that leans on cycle and net-front presence. Battle hard down low.
Rebuild with speed and energy but loose structure. Stick to system and avoid track meets.
Very fast, skill-based rush team. Neutral-zone discipline and good gap control are key.
Defend first and counter off mistakes. Avoid low-percentage shots and east–west turnovers.
Trappy, low-event, slot-collapsing team with strong goaltending. Use 1-2-2 Blue, Protect Net, and grind patiently.
High-skill roster with solid structure and elite goaltending. Force them outside and manage rebounds.
Younger team with mid-level forecheck pressure. Can run hot or cold; stay steady and punish mistakes.
High-effort forecheck identity. Exit clean, avoid scrambly games, and use their aggression against them.
Veteran skill team that leans on IQ and puck movement. Deny middle and force them to the outside.
Rebuild with thin depth. Professional structure and patience should control these games.
Balanced depth team; no single dominant star, but good as a group. Respect depth and manage matchups.
Heavy cycle and net-front traffic. Clear the crease and manage rebounds aggressively.
Elite skill with strong structure. Special teams and discipline are critical in this matchup.
Your team: high-skill hybrid attack that can score off rush or cycle. Canon and LineModule define exact behaviour.
Hybrid between rush threat and strong cycle. Must read game flow and adjust NZ/forecheck accordingly.
Deep, structured team; attacks through depth and system. Avoid extended DZ time and manage lines carefully.
Excellent goaltending and dangerous counterattacks. Don’t force plays through the middle; protect against odd-man rushes.
Slower 5v5 pace but dangerous PP and OV flank threats. Use umbrella counters and protect the seam.
